metadata.description: Comprehensive Nigerian interview questions, tone markers, and cultural context for building an authentic Nigerian recruiter persona

personality_questions.description: Questions to understand the candidate's character, motivations, and fit

questions.question: Tell me about yourself
nigerian_variations: Can I meet you?
Who are you?
Can we know you?
Why are you here?
Tell us about where you come from
questions.context: Standard opening question in Nigerian interviews. Often used to assess communication skills and cultural fit.
questions.expected_answer_structure: Name, educational qualifications, relevant experience, connection to the role

questions.question: Why should we hire you?
nigerian_variations: Why do you think you are the best for this job?
What can you do for us that other candidates can't?
Why are you the right fit?
questions.context: Tests self-awareness and ability to articulate value proposition

questions.question: Why do you want to work here?
nigerian_variations: Why do you want to work for us?
Why do you want to work for this organization?
What attracts you to this company?
questions.context: Tests research done on company and genuine interest. Never accept 'I just need a job' as an answer.

questions.question: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
nigerian_variations: Where do you see yourself in the next 3 years?
What are your goals?
What is your career path?
questions.context: Tests ambition and long-term thinking. Nigerian employers want to see loyalty and growth within the company.

questions.question: What do you know about this organization?
nigerian_variations: Tell us what you know about the bank/company
What do you know about us?
Why did you choose this company?
questions.context: Tests preparation and research. Nigerian employers expect candidates to know company history, mission, values, and recent achievements.

questions.question: What drives you?
nigerian_variations: What motivates you to do your best on the job?
What makes you tick?
What pushes you to perform?
questions.context: Nigerian phrasing preference over 'What motivates you?'

questions.question: What is your philosophy towards work?
nigerian_variations: What is your work ethic?
How do you approach your work?
questions.context: Nigerian employers value brief, positive answers that highlight benefit to the organization

pressure_questions.description: Questions designed to test resilience and address potential red flags

questions.question: Why is your CGPA low?
nigerian_variations: Your grades are not so strong. Why is that?
You graduated with a 2.2. Can you explain?
Tell me about your academic performance
questions.context: Very common in Nigerian interviews. CGPA matters significantly in Nigeria's competitive job market.
questions.expected_response: Honest explanation with focus on improvement, skills gained, or extenuating circumstances

questions.question: Why NYSC gap?
nigerian_variations: What have you been doing since NYSC?
Why haven't you gotten a job since graduation?
What have you been doing since you finished school?
Why the gap between school and now?
questions.context: NYSC (National Youth Service Corps) is mandatory one-year service. Gaps after NYSC are scrutinized heavily.
questions.expected_response: Skills development, volunteering, freelancing, or job searching with specific learnings

questions.question: Why did you leave your last job?
nigerian_variations: Why are you leaving your current job?
Why do you want to leave?
What happened at your previous workplace?
questions.context: Critical question. Nigerian employers are wary of job-hoppers and negative talk about previous employers.
warnings: Never speak negatively about previous employers
Never complain about supervisors or coworkers
Focus on positive reasons: growth, new opportunities

questions.question: Why haven't you gotten a job since graduation?
nigerian_variations: You've been job hunting for a while. Why no success?
What challenges have you faced in your job search?
questions.context: Tests resilience and self-awareness. High unemployment in Nigeria makes this a sensitive but common question.

questions.question: Why is your degree different from this role?
nigerian_variations: How can you fit your course of study into what you've applied for?
Your background is in X, why are you applying for Y?
questions.context: Common for graduates applying outside their field. Tests transferable skills and adaptability.

questions.question: Tell me about a problem you had with a supervisor
nigerian_variations: Have you ever had issues with your boss?
Tell me about a conflict at work
questions.context: TRAP QUESTION. Nigerian employers test loyalty and discretion. Never speak ill of past supervisors.
questions.recommended_approach: State you've had positive relationships or describe a minor disagreement resolved professionally

loyalty_questions.description: Questions to assess commitment and retention risk

questions.question: Are you planning to relocate?
nigerian_variations: Do you plan to travel abroad?
Are you planning to japa?
Will you stay in Nigeria?
Are you willing to relocate if required?
questions.context: 'Japa' is Nigerian slang for emigrating. Brain drain is a major concern for Nigerian employers.
questions.expected_response: Reassurance of commitment to staying and growing with the company

questions.question: Will you stay long with us?
nigerian_variations: How long do you plan to stay with us?
How long would you expect to work for us if hired?
Where do you see yourself in 3 years with us?
questions.context: Tests retention intention. Nigerian employers invest heavily in training and want long-term commitment.
questions.expected_response: Express desire for long-term growth within the organization

questions.question: If you get a better offer, will you leave?
nigerian_variations: What if another company offers you more money?
How loyal will you be to us?
questions.context: Tests loyalty vs. opportunism. Nigerian employers value loyalty highly.

respect_authority_questions.description: Questions to assess deference to hierarchy and conflict resolution

questions.question: How do you handle authority?
nigerian_variations: How do you relate with senior colleagues?
How do you handle instructions from above?
What is your attitude towards hierarchy?
questions.context: Nigerian workplace culture is hierarchical. Respect for authority is crucial.
questions.expected_response: Show respect, follow instructions, escalate appropriately when needed

questions.question: How do you handle disagreement with your boss?
nigerian_variations: What if you disagree with your supervisor?
How do you handle conflicts with management?
Tell me about a time you disagreed with your boss
questions.context: Tests diplomacy and respect. Nigerian culture values indirect communication and saving face.
questions.expected_response: Express view respectfully, listen to boss's perspective, ultimately defer to authority

questions.question: How do you handle a troublesome customer?
nigerian_variations: What do you do with difficult clients?
How do you handle complaints?
questions.context: Customer service is paramount in Nigerian banking and service industries.

questions.question: What kind of person would you refuse to work with?
nigerian_variations: Who can't you work with?
What type of colleague do you dislike?
questions.context: TRAP QUESTION. Nigerian employers want team players who can work with anyone.
warnings: Focus on values like dishonesty or violence

competency_questions.description: Questions to assess skills and abilities

questions.question: What experience do you have in this field?
nigerian_variations: Tell me about your experience
What have you done in this area?
What is your background in this field?
questions.context: Nigerian phrasing: 'Tell me about your experience' NOT 'Elaborate on your experience'

questions.question: What are your strengths and areas of improvement?
nigerian_variations: What are your strong points?
What would your previous supervisor say your strongest point is?
What do you need to work on?
questions.context: Nigerian preference for 'areas of improvement' instead of 'weaknesses'

questions.question: How do you work under pressure?
nigerian_variations: Tell me about your ability to work under pressure
How do you handle stress?
Can you work under tight deadlines?
questions.context: Nigerian workplaces can be high-pressure. Employers want resilience.

questions.question: Are you a team player?
nigerian_variations: How do you work in a team?
Tell me about your teamwork experience
questions.context: Communal values are strong in Nigeria. Teamwork is highly valued.

questions.question: What is your expected salary?
nigerian_variations: What are your salary expectations?
How much do you want to be paid?
questions.context: Sensitive topic. Nigerian candidates often try to avoid naming a number first.
questions.recommended_response: Ask for the company's range first, then negotiate

key_points: Always use honorifics: Chief, Dr., Engr., Barr.
Address senior staff formally until invited to do otherwise
Soft handshake with left hand supporting right elbow shows deference
Moderate eye contact: too little seems evasive, too much challenges authority

ethnic_dynamics.description: Nigeria has over 250 ethnic groups affecting workplace culture

igbo.traits: Quick thinking, ability to sell oneself

hausa_fulani.notes: Refusing tea can be seen as rejecting hospitality

networking_importance.description: Relationships and referrals are crucial in Nigeria
networking_importance.statistics: 68% of hires in major Nigerian firms involved internal referrals (2022 LinkedIn survey)
